title: Riot Pls: Ranked Pls - 2017 Season Ranked Changes

replies.body: Holy Moly Thank you Riot
NP BB
thank you doubly for allowing players to keep their two best roles instead of that order priority from the original queues.

Despite what other people claim this is an original page and really gives a supply of these codes. Also to believe something is 'Phishing' when they don't ask for any login information is just naive, maybe these guys should first google how that works.

The website is clean I tested it myself and it really works. We should be happy that something like this exists and actually gather real information before spreading bullshit

That's still spam and absolutely irrelevant on this thread, so that alone is worth a down vote.

Moreover, rule of thumb on the internet, if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. I didn't look into this one specifically, but even if it's not phishing, there is probably some other trap somewhere. And I won't take the risk to find which one exactly...

Just so I have this correct, Flex Queue can hold any number of people (premade 1 to 5), but Solo/Duo can only have 1 or 2? 

If this is the case, can you add an option for those soloers/duoers that don't care which queue they're in? Kind of like how we have primary/secondary role, but give us the option of choosing between Flex Queue, Solo/Duo Queue, and either. I think if you guys did this, queue times would drop for solo/duo queuers.

This is actually a spectacular idea, like a fill queue for solo players. People who don't care one way or another can be tossed from one queue to the next to fill holes as needed. It could help bring down queue times in both solo/duo and flex queue if done right, so long as there are solo players to jump in the fill queue.

A really great idea, though I'm curious as to how that would be implemented/communicated. Probably with lots of big golden words that warn you "you can be placed in either queue with this option" or somethin, idk. 
One way or another, this should happen. I like this idea. This would be good.
Everyone upvote this so riot can see. This NEEDS to happen.
I think the queues'll have separate ladders, so it'd be kind of weird to be able to just queue for whatever and have the possibility of either getting into a Bronze 4 game or a Diamond 2 game

The way I see it, if a person was in both Bronze 4 (let's say for Flex Queue) and Diamond 2 (for Solo/Duo Q), then the person would know completely well which one he'd go into if he chose either Solo or Flex. If the person really cared about having a Bronze game or a Diamond game, he could just choose which one he wants; if he doesn't care, then having him pick the fill option would fill in any needed holes in either queue, allowing for shorter queue times.

Am I seriously the only one who's fine solo queuing in dynamic queue? Call me old fashioned, but I don't mind "socializing" with other people who play together haha.  One of my main buds that I queue with these days is actually from a quad-premade that I randomly queued with once.
I really hope flex queue does indeed stay haha.
WE KNEW YOU WERE OUT THERE

Seriously though, I also love DQ.  I really hope this works out because with the 5 man system I would join a team and inevitably we would end up rarely playing.

Solo/Duo splits up my group of friends.

But with DQ I can play in 3s or 4s.

I really, really hope we don't go back to just having 5-mans and solo/duo.
I 100% agree. I always play as a group of 3 so this could screw everything up.
Is it your job to make legendary comments on the website for PR? If so, you my friend deserve a raise.

We are out there! I feel the same way. I actually really liked dynamic queue! I've been able to meet a lot of really fun people through it, and it feels nice knowing I can queue up with 2 or 3 friends if that's all I've got online. I also feel like solo/duo was/will be really toxic, like it used to be. You know, people freaking if they don't get their one specific role, mid always being contested for, etc. Idk. I liked dyna-Q, but I must be a minority.
Ranked ARAMs next pls thx.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
If Riot made a ranked ARAM, then if one team got really lucky and got like an amazing wombo combo team, then that game would be really easy to win, so it would be kinda unfair

And you think it's fair now when people constantly troll in ARAM because it's well.. ARAM? They think it's just a fun game mode to relieve stress when there are just as many people playing it seriously as there are ranked players. 

All they need to do is allow bans; not only would that cut down the "amazing wombo combo teams" but also would ensure people wouldn't get stuck with useless picks. Also make it a requirement to own all champions to allow people to swap. 

It's a far fetch, but if 3v3 could have ranked. Why shouldn't ARAM?
Because Twisted Treeline requires strategy and objective in order to win. Howling Abyss does not.
And this, folks, is as close as we'll ever get to riot admitting they were wrong (or could have been wrong). TY Riot for finally listening.

> [{quoted}](name=NEON Brute,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=ozloAIxn,comment-id=0085,timestamp=2016-10-05T21:52:16.241+0000)
>
> And this, folks, is as close as we'll ever get to riot admitting they were wrong (or could have been wrong). TY Riot for finally listening.

It _is_ Riot admitting that they were wrong, so yeah, that's as close to admitting wrong as Riot can get.
We were wrong

> [{quoted}](name=Ghostcrawler,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=ozloAIxn,comment-id=008500000000,timestamp=2016-10-05T23:01:06.080+0000)
>
> We were wrong

I was not expecting Ghostcrawler to comment on this.

Keep up the great work Ghostcrawler! You're doing a wonderful job keeping up relations with the community and I think we're very lucky to have you designing League as well as interacting with us on the Boards (and reddit, but I don't participate in discussion there).
This is nice....but it stil doesn't make up for Championship Maokai.....

*Victorious

If you are gonna whine, do it properly

Maybe stop complaining that they are giving us a skin for a s*%& champion and start complaining that they allow champions to be garbage for extended periods of time.








{{champion:6}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:30}}
HEY DONT HATE {{champion:6}} JUST BECAUSE HES BEAUTIFUL!
Did riot just admit to there mistakes and are willing to listen? This is the first time in a while I am actually glad of one of your big choices for the ranked system. Thank you Riot! ^_^
They just admitted their mistake two patches ago with the Kog'Maw rework revert.
They do it regularly but somehow most people's eyes don't register those particular words in a sentence.
rito i thank you for bringing solo/duo back <3
You are welcome.
BRING BACK TEAM BUILDER!!!!
Replace normal blind with team builder, people can pick the champs they want without being banned yet no arguing over roles.
a lot of people choose blind cause it has short queue times.
Rank 1 3v3 NA player here.. Is this the end of 3s?
Curious on this as well. It seems as if they didn't mention that much on the if it will stay or not

I never minded premades on either team even as a solo-only player, but I'm glad they are doing what Lyte said they were going to do in the first place.

> Emblems were a band-aid solution

Eh, what exactly did they solve? They did nothing.

Exactly - just like a band-aid.

They're just a cover-up of the real problem, in hopes it'll not get worse, while something else does the actual fixing.

I'm wary, but optimistic, of the new system.

Band-aids actually serve a purpose. They hold a small wound together and help stop the blood so it can start healing, and helps prevent it from getting dirty. Calling the emblems a band-aid is only appropriate if you put the band-aid next to the wound as a reminder that it's there, but not actually on it to help.

The "Band-Aid" was an attempt to make players feel that they earned their spot compared to the boosted animals. You see a Plat/Diamond player with a SoloQ Badge, and you'd _Supposedly_ respect them more than someone with a DynamicQ badge.

At least, that's how i reason it.

Honestly guys the reason I dislike dynamic que is not because of ladder integrity or that I feel disadvantaged.

I dislike dynamic que becuase when you get that 1/20 chance of playing against a 3 man premade, the game is just straight up not fun.

I'm talking about the mid jungle and support camping your blue buff in the bush. Teams camping in the river bush. Friends flaming when they get kills because they are more confident with their buddies. Having 0 communication directed at you when you are the solo with a group of 4.

The problem with dynamic que is that people can be scumbags when they are trying to impress their friends and I quite frankly think they can just all play their ego game in a pen together.

Here is something I don't understand. In the recent dev blog (http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/riot-games/editorial/dev-new001-competition-beyond-ranked) by New001, they state that Riot wants a more competitive atmosphere akin to that of the Riot Rumble. However now you're splitting the player population by setting out two sets of queues with two separate ladders. How can Solo/Duo queue ever achieve this level of competitiveness? And without voice comms, how can flex queue ever attempt to do so if you have 3-2 mans in game or 4-1s?
Another point for concern, if up and coming Challenger teams want to practice, but all of the challenger players are playing solo/duo queue, how could they hope to compete?
Frankly speaking, solo / duo can't recreate the experience that New001 was talking about. That would have to be an entirely new feature, probably built only for premade 5s.

Solo Q will never achieve this. It was only brought back because people bitched.

Voice com will not be a thing while the client is being rebuilt.

Oh I know that comms and anything cant really be introduced until the new client comes out. This just feels like Riot is now turning its back on those who like DQ. They didn't provide adequate tools for DQ to be successful, and now they said that they are willing to abandon it all together and make it 5s only. Honestly, the dev blog I linked just makes it seems like they will never bridge the gap. It feels like a pipe dream that can't come true. This announcement feels that while yes Riot is willing to look out for 1 group of players they will easily abandon another to do so.
Flex Q is launching in a very similar state to current DQ. It's up to the DQ community to keep it around. If not enough people play it, Riot will cater to the majority opinion. I think that's fair
